candidates.title: Photo has been edited to show Trumps parents wearing KKK robes
candidates.content:
CLAIM: Picture shows Mary and Fred Trump, wearing Ku Klux Klan robes, standing with son Donald Trump in 1999.
APS ASSESSMENT: False. The photo, which was taken of Trump with his parents in 1992, has been altered.
THE FACTS: The manipulated photo, edited to make it appear Trumps parents are wearing Klan garb, has circulated before on social media. It surfaced again this week on Facebook and Twitter.
The original photo was taken by Judie Burstein in 1992, according to Globe Photos, a celebrity and entertainment photo company that archived the image in March 2004.
The image shows Trump in a red tie and a black suit standing with his arms wrapped around his mother and father. Mary Trump is wearing a pink and black floral suit, with pearls draped around her neck. Fred Trump is wearing a navy suit, red pocket square and polka dot tie. The three Trumps posed for the photo against a marble wall backdrop and a sign that reads theater tickets.
Trump followed his father into the real estate business. Fred Trump, who made a fortune in real estate, died in 1999 at the age of 93. Mary Trump died in 2000, at the age of 88.
___
This is part of The Associated Press ongoing effort to fact-check misinformation that is shared widely online, including work with Facebook to identify and reduce the circulation of false stories on the platform.
Heres more information on Facebooks fact-checking program: https://www.facebook.com/help/1952307158131536

candidates.title: Donald Trump's Parents Wore Ku Klux Klan Attire?
candidates.content:
Claim:
A photograph shows Donald Trump posing with his parents in Ku Klux Klan robes.
Rating:
False
About this rating
A photograph purportedly showing Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump standing with his parents after they have donned Ku Klux Klan robes added to the noise as the presidential race heated up in September 2016:
This photograph is not genuine and has been rather clumsily altered from the original, in which all three of them are wearing perfectly normal (and color-cordinated) clothing without a hint of Klan insignia:

final_result.explanation:
The original caption claims that the photograph depicts Donald Trump posing with his parents in Ku Klux Klan robes.  Both the internal and external validation checks strongly refute this claim. 

Internal Validation:
The internal check has a confidence score of 8, indicating a significant level of doubt about the accuracy of the caption. The explanation notes that while the image shows Trump with his mother and another man in robes with symbols, it doesn't definitively confirm these are KKK robes. This acknowledges the ambiguity present in the image itself and indicates a cautious approach to verifying the caption's claim.

External Validation:
The external check holds a significantly higher confidence score of 10.  It provides irrefutable evidence that the image has been digitally manipulated.  This is established by referencing sources that explicitly state the image's alteration and offer details on how the original photo differed, confirming the absence of KKK robes in the original. The supporting points from the external validation directly address the core claim of the caption, stating that the image is a fabricated version of a picture showing Trump with his parents in ordinary clothing. This is a decisive piece of evidence that undermines the original caption.

Discrepancy Analysis:
There's a minor discrepancy in the confidence scores between the internal (8) and external (10) checks. However, the external check's stronger evidence – which includes direct references to sources confirming the photo manipulation – significantly outweighs the internal check's more tentative assessment. The internal check primarily points out the visual ambiguity of the altered image, while the external check provides irrefutable proof of the image's fabrication, directly contradicting the caption's statement.

Entity Alignment:
The entity analysis aligns well with the external validation. Both show that the image has been falsely altered. The original image's context doesn't show Trump's parents wearing KKK robes. This aligns with the external validation's conclusion that the image is digitally manipulated, demonstrating a consistent narrative that refutes the original caption's claim. 

Conclusion:
Given the strong external validation (with its robust sources and explanation of image manipulation) and the largely consistent internal check (acknowledging ambiguities in the altered image), it is highly confident that the original caption is out of context. The external validation provides compelling and well-sourced evidence to definitively refute the claim. Therefore, the overall confidence score is 10, and the conclusion is that the caption is out of context and false.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external checks strongly indicate that the original caption is false. The external check provides definitive proof of image manipulation, showing the caption's claim to be a misrepresentation of the original photograph.
